content.content: Quick Lending Market Update tl;dr  The lending market across the board has been risking off in May This has led to a drop of $34.9M of annualized interest revenue since the first of May, from $66.4M to $31.5M Maker has mostly maintained market share    This analysis covers Maker, Liquity, AAVE v2, and COMP v2 on ETH L1. Data is as of 5/31/22. Outstanding debt (against volatile crypto assets) at Maker has been in decline since November but experienced a sharp decline in May:  image1220×792 62.7 KB  The same drop can be seen in other major lending protocols:  image1436×1080 158 KB  As shown below, Maker has maintained market share throughout this dip in May:  image1614×1136 145 KB  Most of this risking off comes from the largest customers, industry wide:  image1668×1002 151 KB  On May 16th, rates on WBTC-A and WBTC-B vaults were lowered by 100bps and 50 bps respectively, which is clearly seen on the below chart. Risk off has been disproportionately in our higher-rate vaults, slowly lowering our blended average interest rate:  image1230×784 55.5 KB  These WBTC rate decreases were made in response to decreasing share in this market since November, easily visible on the following chart of total stablecoins borrowed against WBTC:  image1366×864 114 KB  Thus far, it is inconsclusive whether this change will lead to a substantial gain in WBTC market share. Below is a zoomed in view of Maker’s WBTC market share since 4/1/22 with some relevant dates overlaid. Interestingly enough, it seems that the market has not yet reacted much to liquidity mining in AAVE v2 ending, suggesting the market might be slow to act:  image1382×720 114 KB  The general stablecoin borrowing market has been seeing declining rates in recent months as well. For instance, here is the (unsubsidized) borrow rate of USDC on Compound declining from 3.59% to 2.2% since March 29:  image2060×1080 139 KB  Similarly, here is the (unsubsidized) USDC borrow rate on AAVE v2 declining from 3.11% to 2.18% since April 16:  image1178×886 69 KB    These two effects, lower outstanding loans & lower rates, have led to a sharp ~53% drop of annualized interest revenue since the first of the month, from $66.4M to $31.5M (-$34.9M):  image1238×790 68 KB  Conclusion  The lending market all around has been suffering and Maker is not immune. Maker vault annualized interest revenues have dropped $34.9M since the first of May, from $66.4M to $31.5M Maker has maintained market share on stablecoin borrows fairly well despite losing share in borrows against WBTC between November and early May Thus far, it is inconclusive whether lowering borrowing rates will lead to a significant increase in demand / market share of our WBTC vaults  Appendix  image1658×1018 176 KB  Maker borrow (against volatile crypto-assets) by borrow amount  image1856×330 34.4 KB  Liquity borrow by borrow amount  image1856×422 36.1 KB  AAVE v2 net stablecoin borrow by borrow amount  image1856×422 98.5 KB  COMP v2 net stablecoin borrow by borrow amount  image1856×466 87.4 KB

Thanks for the update. Do you have any data indicating if Wrapped BTC has been redeemed, or if it has moved to other platforms, or chains? I guess the redeemable portion might be hard to track since it is a centralized product. Thanks again!

Hey Progreso, Some of it was redeemed but not really a substantial amount:  image1956×554 55.1 KB  I think the bigger trends here are:  In general, the market has been risking off overall Celsius has been moving their WBTC and loans against it to AAVE v2
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
